snippet: Pacific Gas and Electric, California's largest electric utility, asked state regulators today to end a freeze on customers' power rates and allow it to recover losses from buying power on the wholesale power market this year.    The utility propos...
lead_paragraph: Pacific Gas and Electric, California's largest electric utility, asked state regulators today to end a freeze on customers' power rates and allow it to recover losses from buying power on the wholesale power market this year. The utility proposed recovering $3.4 billion in such costs from customers over five years. The plan would keep bills from immediately doubling, the utility said in a filing with the state's Public Utilities Commission.
abstract: Pacific Gas & Electric asks California regulators to end freeze on customers' power rates and let it recover losses from buying power on wholesale market; seeks to recover $3.4 billion in such costs over five years; says plan would keep bills from immediately doubling (S)
